paper_abstract: This paper is concerned with a nonlocal diffusion equation with Dirichlet boundary conditions and a reaction term {partial derivative/partial derivative tu(x, t) = integral(RN)J(x - y)(u(y, t) - u(x, t))dy + e(beta t)u(p)(x, t), x is an element of Omega, t > 0, u(x, t) = 0, x is not an element of Omega, t >= 0, u(x, 0) = u(0)(x) >= 0, x is an element of Omega. Our main result shows that this nonlocal diffusion problem has a critical exponent p*(beta) which coincides with that of the corresponding local diffusion problem. The blow-up rate of solutions is also discussed. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: Critical exponent for nonlocal diffusion equations with Dirichlet boundary condition
